articles.summary: In today's digital world, enhancing your web design skills is vital for staying competitive. With the growing presence of artificial intelligence (AI) tools, designers now have innovative resources that can simplify processes, boost creative thinking and improve the quality of web design. AI-powered tools have led to a 40% reduction in time spent on mundane tasks, allowing designers to dedicate more energy to creative endeavors. AI tools make high-level personalization achievable by analyzing user data and customizing experiences.

articles.author: Travis Fisher
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) promises to revolutionize industries, amplify productivity, and unlock innovations unimagined a decade ago. Data centers consume vast amounts of electricity to train models, process information, and support real-time applications. The US electricity industry is not up to the task of powering a fast-moving new industry with an insatiable thirst for 'juice'. Only by reimagining the industry through the lens of liberty and market dynamism can we meet the AI moment. Regulators should remove barriers to electricity supply.

articles.title: How to Detect Text Written by ChatGPT and Other AI Tools
articles.author: PC Mag
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a popular AI-generated text generator. It's being used in emails, cover letters, marketing pitches, college essays, coding, and some news stories. It can be difficult to tell if a text is written by an AI or by a human. GPTZero was developed in 2023 by Edward Tian, a senior at Princeton. It analyzes text for 'perplexity' (how complex the ideas and language are) and 'burstiness' (if there's a blend of long and short sentences).

articles.title: Queen's research transforms prostate cancer care with AI
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: At Queen's University Belfast, a revolution is underway in the fight against prostate cancer. Researchers are harnessing the power of artificial intelligence (AI) to transform every aspect of patient care, from diagnosis and treatment planning to minimizing side effects and improving patient outcomes. The research team is exploring innovative radiotherapy techniques, such as stereotactic ablative body radiotherapy (SABR) and novel radiotherapy combinations. AI is also revolutionizing cancer diagnostics.

articles.title: Frontex sees success of asylum measures on European external borders
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Last year, Frontex intercepted 239,000 migrants at external borders, a 38% decrease compared to the 400,000 attempts stopped in 2023. EU's strategic partnerships with key countries are making a tangible difference in reducing irregular migration. EU-Tunisian agreement provides financial assistance to Tunisia in exchange for stricter border control measures. The Balkan route, a prominent pathway for migrants seeking EU entry, has experienced a 78% reduction in arrivals.

articles.title: AI's Transformative Impact On Real Estate

articles.summary: AI is revolutionizing the real estate industry. It's helping sellers, buyers, and investors make better data-driven decisions. AI's ability to analyze data, automate processes and help humans make better decisions is driving value across the board.

articles.summary: Colorado was among the first states to regulate artificial intelligence last year. AI promises to revolutionize our lives and Colorado was one of the first to regulate the technology.   iReport.com: What do you think about artificial intelligence? Share your thoughts.

articles.title: Saudi Arabia sets guidelines for using AI in education
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: The Saudi education authorities have set guidelines for use of artificial intelligence in the educational process in the kingdom. The guidelines are designed to help students learn better using artificial intelligence. The step is the result of cooperation between the Ministry of Eudcation and the Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority.

articles.title: The Guardian view on a global AI race: geopolitics, innovation and the rise of chaos
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Vladimir Putin wants Russia to lead in artificial intelligence by 2030. Western tech sanctions after Russia's invasion of Ukraine might have dented his ambitions. Last week, the Chinese lab DeepSeek started developing artificial intelligence.      Â

articles.title: Google pushes AI education for workers, lawmakers
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google is looking to shape public perception and policies on artificial intelligence ahead of a global wave of AI regulation. A key priority is building out knowledge of AI and using AI tools, which makes for better AI policy and opens up new opportunities for Google.

articles.title: Sir Elton John and Sir Paul McCartney warn of AI copyright 'rip-off' amid Government plans
articles.author: Belfast Telegraph
articles.summary: Sir Elton John has warned that artificial intelligence will 'dilute and threaten young artists' earnings even further' as he backs Sir Paul McCartney's criticism of it.      Â  “Artificial intelligence will diminish and threaten artists' earning even further”

articles.title: French AI ‘Lucie' looks très chic, but keeps getting answers wrong
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: France's artificial intelligence chatbot Lucie was launched last week with high-flying and patriotic ambitions. Lucie, backed by President Macron, would bring "trustworthiness, fairness and accountability" to the world of generative tools. It would take on anglophone rivals such as OpenAI's ChatGPT.

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT to name 2 UK stocks it would sell in a heartbeat. I ...
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: ChatGPT is not a financial adviser and can't provide specific stock recommendations. ChatGPT can't name two FTSE 100 shares it would sell in a heartbeat, but admits it's not a substitute for human expertise when it comes to stock buying and selling.

articles.title: Spies want to harness the power of AI — but need bespoke tech to do it
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Microsoft has created an AI system cut off from the internet for US intelligence agencies and the military. The US is planning to integrate AI into a wide range of national security-related tasks with the help of AI programs.    in the CIA's headquarters in Langley, Virginia, in 2022.

articles.title: How To Gain Vital Skills In Conversational Icebreakers Via Nimble Use Of Generative AI
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Generative AI can help with coming up with and using viable icebreakers as a practice aid for people who don't know how to do it very well. Here's the inside scoop on how to use AI to help with this task.   .

articles.title: Breaking myths about India's AI capabilities
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: During his visit to India last June, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warned Indian engineers not to try to compete with Silicon Valley on AI training foundation models. Nandan Nilekani has emphasised focusing on simpler efforts like computing infrastructure and AI cloud services.

articles.title: Mahakumbh: Revamped AI Chatbot Helping Pilgrims Find Parking, Food Courts And Hospitals
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: A new version of the AI chatbot is guiding pilgrims on parking, food courts and hospitals within 1 km radius of the devotees in Prayagraj, India. It is guided by an artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot that is now smarter than the previous version.

articles.title: The AI Frenzy Engulfs DeFi Chains – Here's Why $MIND Can Be the Next Crypto ...
articles.author: Bitcoinist
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) agents are being integrated into the decentralized finance (DeFi) mechanism to solve the issues of information overload and make crypto market decisions more efficient. Mike Cahill, Douro Labs CEO, said in an interview that these AI agents are safe.

articles.title: China's shoestring AI humiliates US and could undermine Trump
articles.author: AOL
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a Chinese AI model that can generate human-like conversation. It was released on the same day as Donald Trump's inauguration. It has since been tested against some of America's most powerful AI programs. It is a wake-up call to Donald Trump.

articles.title: Alphabet Inc pushes global initiative to educate workers and lawmakers on AI
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Getting more organizations and people familiar with AI makes for better AI policy and opens up new opportunities, according to an Alphabet executive. Google is already facing an unprecedented regulatory onslaught and is looking to shape public perception.   .      "It's a virtuous cycle"

articles.title: Universities seek to restrict AI use by students
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence helped Chinese students prepare for their final exams in January before the semester ended. A law major at a university in Shanghai used AI to produce Power-Point slides in 5 minutes and nobody noticed that he had used AI for help with the presentation. The software can turn in a PPT document in just 5 minutes.

articles.title: Why China's DeepSeek has US wowed, and worried
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: DeepSeek-R1 is an open-source language model developed by Chinese company. It's designed to mimic human reasoning. It processes information step-by-step, making it skilled at understanding it. It is a cost-effective alternative to advanced AI systems like OpenAI's o1.

articles.title: AI is a force for good – and Britain needs to be a maker of ideas, not a mere taker
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Prof Stephen Hawking warned 11 years ago that explosive growth in artificial intelligence could menace the future of humanity. Two years ago, more than a thousand leaders in AI feared 'loss of control' due to its exponential growth. They called for chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and cybersecurity risks.

articles.title: U.S. attempts to prevent China from catching up in AI
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: U.S. has tried to prevent China from catching up in artificial intelligence. Recent breakthroughs by Chinese companies are disrupting the industry and putting U.S.'s efforts to prevent it at risk, according to Mafafn.

articles.title: Meta to spend $65bn on AI goals, Zuckerberg says
articles.author: Business Day
articles.summary: Meta Platforms plans to spend as much as $65bn this year to expand its artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. As part of the investment, Meta will ramp up hiring for AI experts. This will be a defining year for AI, according to CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

articles.title: Chinese AI applications now have bigger aims — they're looking beyond chatbots
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Chinese companies have released AI models that compete with OpenAI's ChatGPT in the last week. OpenAI has a chatbot that is similar to chatbot.com. Open AI's chatbot is not ready to compete with chatbot, however.

articles.title: Elton John warns AI plans would 'threaten' artist earnings as he backs McCartney
articles.author: RTE
articles.summary: Elton John has warned that artificial intelligence will threaten young artists' earnings even further. He backed Paul McCartney's criticism of a proposed overhaul of copyright law in the UK. The use of copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence models is the subject of a newly launched initiative.

articles.title: Silicon Valley is having a meltdown over China's new AI models
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI lab, has built a set of efficient artificial intelligence models that make Silicon Valley's best look outdated. The models are fifty times more efficient than even top U.S. offerings. The has thrown American tech giants like OpenAI, Google, and Meta into a state of uncertainty.

articles.title: AI's Transformative Impact On Real Estate
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI is revolutionizing real estate by automating tasks, personalizing home searches, aiding data-driven decisions, and enhancing customer experiences. It's revolutionizing the industry by personalizing tasks, helping with data- driven decisions and enhancing customers' experiences.

articles.title: We asked OpenAI's o1 about the top AI trends in 2025 — here's a look ...
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: There are many AI trends this year, which is a testament to AI's general-purpose value. OpenAI's o1 shares some of them with iReporter.com. iReport.com has a look at the trends in AI this year.

articles.title: Paul McCartney says AI can rip off artists
articles.summary: The government is consulting on whether to let tech firms use copyrighted material to help train artificial intelligence models unless the creators explicitly opt out. Paul McCartney says it would make it harder for artists to retain control of their work and undermine Britain's creative industries. Publishers, artists' organizations and media companies oppose weakening copyright protections.
